intro: Alkanna hispida, commonly known as the hairy alkanna, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive, rough texture. Alkanna hispida is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal in dry gardens.
